title: Image and Voice Optimization Strategies for Online Mathematics Instructors

context.additional_context: Learners access the LMS via personal devices (BYOD) and demonstrate learning outcomes through project-based assessments. As a beginner-level math curriculum, it experimentally verifies the impact of instructors' visual/audio delivery methods on learning effectiveness

learning_goals: Quantitative analysis of changes in learning achievement based on instructors' image types (original/embellished/virtual/none)
Comparative analysis of differences in learning satisfaction based on instructors' voice types (original/altered/synthetic) to derive optimal voice expression strategies
Measurement of learners' perceived social presence and academic emotions (e.g., boredom) to identify the influence of image/voice types
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
